abstract.p: Patricia Boyle letter on June 11 article holds demographics prevent real diversity in Connecticut classrooms (S)

block.p: Simple demographics prevents real diversity in classrooms: blacks constitute only 13 to 14 percent of our population.
Secondly, black teachers feel more comfortable in black urban classrooms as do white teachers in white suburban settings. In a free society diversity cannot and should not be mandated by government.
Simple demographics prevents real diversity in classrooms: blacks constitute only 13 to 14 percent of our population.
Secondly, black teachers feel more comfortable in black urban classrooms as do white teachers in white suburban settings. In a free society diversity cannot and should not be mandated by government.

And as to the N.A.A.C.P.'s suggestion that ''the state should consider some kind of financial rewards, such as bonuses, to recruit more minority applicants'': such a proposal is blatantly racist and discriminatory; to suggest that skin color determines teachers' salaries will lead to a massive exodus of every white teacher from every school in the state.
What today's children need is not more racist politics, but good teachers, knowledgeable teachers, and caring teachers, be they black, white, red, yellow or like Barney, purple.
